objective.title: Game Objective
objective.content:
The Imposter is a social deduction game.

Regular players know the secret word and must find the imposter.

The imposter does NOT know the word and must figure it out without being caught.

setup.title: Setup
setup.content:
You need 3 to 15 players.

One player creates the room and shares the code with others.

The host selects a word category and configures game options.

secretWord.title: The Secret Word
secretWord.content:
When the game starts, everyone sees if they are the imposter or not.

Regular players see the secret word.

The imposter sees a message indicating they are the imposter and may receive an abstract hint.

imposter.title: The Imposter
imposter.content:
The imposter must pretend they know the word.

They may receive an abstract hint related to the word to help them blend in.

They must give convincing clues without being too obvious or too vague.

clues.title: Clue Rounds
clues.content:
Each round, everyone gives ONE word as a clue.

Clues should relate to the secret word without saying it directly.

Be careful! If you're too obvious, the imposter will guess the word. If you're too vague, you'll look suspicious.

voting.title: Voting
voting.content:
After clues, everyone votes for who they think is the imposter.

The player with the most votes is eliminated.

If the imposter is eliminated, they get one last chance to guess the word.

winning.title: Who Wins?
winning.content:
üèÜ The GROUP wins if:
‚Ä¢ They eliminate the imposter AND they don't guess the word

üé≠ The IMPOSTER wins if:
‚Ä¢ They are not discovered after all rounds
‚Ä¢ They are eliminated but guess the word correctly

tips.title: Tips
tips.content:
üí° For regular players:
‚Ä¢ Give specific but not obvious clues
‚Ä¢ Pay attention to others' clues

üïµÔ∏è For the imposter:
‚Ä¢ Pay attention to all clues
‚Ä¢ Give generic clues that could work for many words
‚Ä¢ Don't panic!
